page.title: 10LANGUAGE
page.content: In Barnsley people talk in a different way.If you want to tell somebody to shut the door you would say{shut duer.}Words are pronounced differently and most people in Barnsley miss words like "the" out as in these sentences:{It int in tin}(it isn't in the tin);{Go tu shop}(go to the shop). People pronounce words differently such as{watter}(water), {babbie}(baby) .Instead of saying "you" Barnsley people say{thee}or{tha} as in these sentences:{Wat's tha doin'? (what are you doing?){Wat's tha sey? (What did you say?) These sentences have been shortened. People also have special phrase such as{put coil in {ashoil}_put the coal in the fireplace_ {Gie oer}_stop it and{Are tha laking {aht?}which means Are you playing out? Laking comes from the Viking languages.
